approval_data.project_name: V-KYC recordings to be fetched for Audit requirements
approval_data.project_summary: The project aims to develop a portal/dashboard for the VKYC team to independently fetch V-KYC recordings for audit and internal requirements, eliminating the current manual process of requesting recordings from the IT data server team.
project_goals: Enable V-KYC team leads and process managers to independently fetch V-KYC recordings.
Streamline the process of retrieving V-KYC recordings for audit and internal requirements.
Reduce dependency on the IT data server team for V-KYC recording retrieval.
approval_data.business_context: Currently, the VKYC team relies on manual requests to the IT data server team to obtain VKYC recordings stored on the LTF 'NFS (Network File System)' server for audit and internal requirements. This manual process is inefficient and time-consuming, requiring a change to a more automated and self-service model.

requirements.description: A portal/Dashboard shall be created for VKYC recording retrieval.
All VKYC recordings for approved PL-VKYC cases shall be made available on the portal.
Recordings shall be available for search and retrieval by date, month, and year.
Recordings shall be visible and searchable by LAN ID.
The portal shall provide an option for users to upload an Excel or text file containing LAN IDs for bulk video recording requests.
The uploaded file for bulk requests must contain a minimum of 2 and a maximum of 50 LAN IDs.
The uploaded file for bulk requests must be in CSV or TXT format.
Upon file upload, the system shall trigger a call to a backend API to process the bulk request.
Upon receiving a response from the backend, the results for bulk requests shall be displayed on the screen in a tabular format.
The tabular display for bulk requests shall include a 'Download All' option.
The table pagination for displayed results shall show only 10 records at a time.
The bulk download functionality shall download only 10 records at a time.
Clicking on a single LAN ID in the search results shall initiate the recording download for that specific LAN ID.
Access to the portal screen shall be restricted to very limited users, specifically VKYC Team Leaders and Process Managers.

stakeholders: B. Ops â€“ V-KYC Team (Process Owner)
success_criteria: VKYC Team Leads and Process Managers can independently access and download V-KYC recordings.
Elimination of manual requests to the IT data server team for V-KYC recordings.
All approved PL-VKYC cases' recordings are accessible via the portal.
The portal supports both single and bulk (up to 50 LAN IDs) recording downloads.
constraints: Maximum 50 LAN IDs per bulk upload file.
Minimum 2 LAN IDs per bulk upload file.
Bulk upload file format must be CSV or TXT.
Table pagination displays only 10 records at a time.
Bulk download processes only 10 records at a time.
Access to the portal is restricted to VKYC Team Leaders and Process Managers.
Scope is limited to 'All Approved PL-VKYC cases'.
assumptions: VKYC recordings are consistently available on the LTF 'NFS (Network File System)' server.
The backend API for processing recording requests exists or will be developed and is performant.
LAN IDs are unique identifiers for VKYC cases and are consistently formatted.
The 'Approved PL-VKYC cases' scope is clearly defined and understood by all parties.
The necessary infrastructure for the portal (e.g., hosting, database) will be provided.
risks: Data security and unauthorized access if access control is not robustly implemented and monitored.
Performance issues with bulk downloads or large numbers of recordings impacting user experience.
Data integrity issues if recordings on NFS server are corrupted, missing, or inaccessible.
Dependency on the backend API's availability, performance, and correctness.
Scalability challenges if the volume of VKYC recordings or concurrent users increases significantly.
Potential for misinterpretation of 'Date for cross checking the V-KKYC approved date (for IT usage)'.

domain_specific_details.V-KYC: Video Know Your Customer process, a method for customer identification and verification via video.
domain_specific_details.PL-VKYC: Personal Loan V-KYC cases, referring to V-KYC recordings specifically for Personal Loan applications.
domain_specific_details.LAN ID: A unique identifier associated with a V-KYC case or loan.
domain_specific_details.NFS Server: Network File System server, a centralized storage location where VKYC recordings are currently stored.
domain_specific_details.LTF: L&T Finance (implied from 'LTFH Confidential' footer), the organization operating the V-KYC process.

recommendations: Add a dedicated section for Non-Functional Requirements (NFRs) covering performance, scalability, detailed security, usability, reliability, and maintainability.
Provide more detailed specifications for the backend API integration, including expected response times, error handling, and data formats.
Clarify the user experience for bulk downloads exceeding 10 records (e.g., does it trigger multiple downloads, or a single zipped file containing all requested records?).
Define clear error handling mechanisms for scenarios like invalid LAN IDs, missing recordings, or API failures, and how these are communicated to the user.
Include explicit test scenarios and acceptance criteria for each functional requirement to guide testing efforts.
Detail the security measures for data at rest and in transit, beyond just access control, such as encryption and audit logging.
Specify data retention policies for the V-KYC recordings on the portal and the NFS server.
Clarify the purpose and usage of 'Date for cross checking the V-KKYC approved date (for IT usage)'.

identified_gaps: Lack of explicit Non-Functional Requirements (e.g., performance, scalability, detailed security, usability, reliability, disaster recovery).
No detailed error handling specifications for various failure scenarios (e.g., invalid LAN ID, API failure, missing recording, network issues).
Ambiguity regarding the exact mechanism for downloading more than 10 records from a 50-LAN ID bulk request.
Absence of detailed security requirements beyond user access control (e.g., data encryption, vulnerability management, audit trails).
No mention of data retention or archival policies for the recordings accessible via the portal.
No explicit section for 'Interfaces' or 'Testing Requirements' (though 'Business Test Scenarios' is mentioned as NA, implying a lack of detail).
Unclear definition and purpose of the 'Date for cross checking the V-KKYC approved date (for IT usage)'.
recommendations_for_completion: Conduct workshops with stakeholders to define and document comprehensive Non-Functional Requirements, including specific metrics and targets.
Elaborate on error handling processes and user notifications for various failure points within the system.
Clarify the bulk download mechanism for files containing more than 10 LAN IDs, specifying if it's a single consolidated download (e.g., a zip file) or multiple iterative downloads.
Add a dedicated security section outlining data encryption, access logging, vulnerability assessment, and other relevant security measures.
Define clear data retention and archival policies for the V-KYC recordings on both the NFS server and the portal.
Develop detailed test cases and acceptance criteria for all functional and non-functional requirements to ensure thorough testing.
Seek clarification from IT and business stakeholders regarding the 'Date for cross checking' requirement and its technical implications.
